channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Veteran diplomat on Trump's objectives with his World Economic Forum speech
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel asks veteran diplomat Richard Haass about President Trump's objectives with his address to the World Economic Forum in Switzerland.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel asks veteran diplomat Richard Haass about President Trump's objectives with his address to the World Economic Forum in Switzerland.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: The U.S. is fighting another measles outbreak. This time in South Carolina
item.description: South Carolina is fighting a new, fast-growing outbreak of the measles, as concern grows that the U.S. is poised to lose its measles elimination status.
item.content:encoded: South Carolina is fighting a new, fast-growing outbreak of the measles, as concern grows that the U.S. is poised to lose its measles elimination status.
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: It's showdown time for the Fed's independence at the Supreme Court
item.description: At issue are President Trump's efforts to break with 112 years of law and precedent by firing Lisa Cook, a member of the Federal Reserve's governing board.
item.content:encoded:
At issue are President Trump's efforts to break with 112 years of law and precedent by firing Lisa Cook, a member of the Federal Reserve's governing board.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Trump backs off tariff threats and hails 'framework of a future deal' on Greenland
item.description: The U.S. president is in Davos, Switzerland, for the World Economic Forum's annual meeting. President Trump's push to acquire Greenland has turned to antagonism toward allies in recent days.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. president is in Davos, Switzerland, for the World Economic Forum's annual meeting. President Trump's push to acquire Greenland has turned to antagonism toward allies in recent days.

(Image credit: Fabrice Coffrini)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump to address World Economic Forum, DOJ subpoenas Minnesota officials in obstruction probe, SCOTUS to hear case that could give presidents unprecedented control over the Fed.
item.content:encoded: Trump to address World Economic Forum, DOJ subpoenas Minnesota officials in obstruction probe, SCOTUS to hear case that could give presidents unprecedented control over the Fed.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Denyce Graves sings her swan song on Met stage
item.description: Mezzo-soprano Denyce Graves is retiring from the stage after a last performance as Maria in the Gershwins' Porgy and Bess at the Metropolitan Opera, and looking ahead to directing and mentoring.
item.content:encoded:
Mezzo-soprano Denyce Graves is retiring from the stage after a last performance as Maria in the Gershwins' Porgy and Bess at the Metropolitan Opera, and looking ahead to directing and mentoring.

(Image credit: Elias Williams for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Trump's Greenland demand has been a gift to U.S. geopolitical foes like Russia
item.description: The tensions between the U.S. and Western Allies are a source of satisfaction to many in the Kremlin.
item.content:encoded: The tensions between the U.S. and Western Allies are a source of satisfaction to many in the Kremlin.
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: In Minneapolis, a community band has become part of the soundtrack of resistance
item.description: Brass Solidarity was formed after George Floyd was murdered by a police officer in 2020. Now, the band is playing at protests against federal immigration enforcement, in an effort to bring joy to residents and break potential tension.
item.content:encoded:
Brass Solidarity was formed after George Floyd was murdered by a police officer in 2020. Now, the band is playing at protests against federal immigration enforcement, in an effort to bring joy to residents and break potential tension.

(Image credit: Erin Trieb for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Texas and Louisiana return to court to get Ten Commandments displayed in schools
item.description: A federal appeals court heard arguments Tuesday about whether the Ten Commandments must be displayed in public school classrooms in Texas and Louisiana.
item.content:encoded: A federal appeals court heard arguments Tuesday about whether the Ten Commandments must be displayed in public school classrooms in Texas and Louisiana.
item.dc:creator: Aubri Juhasz

item.title: At Mount Angel Abbey, brewing beer requires hops and a lot of prayers
item.description: At Mount Angel Abbey in Oregon, one of the last monastic breweries in the country, brewing beer is a sacred art.
item.content:encoded: At Mount Angel Abbey in Oregon, one of the last monastic breweries in the country, brewing beer is a sacred art.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Wood
